author: Special Correspondent
text:
President Pranab Mukherjee being gifted an Aranmula mirror at the valedictory function to mark the 155th anniversary of the Indian Penal Code in Kochi on Friday.— Photo: H.Vibhu.

President Pranab Mukherjee has called for a “thorough revision” of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) for meeting the “changing needs of the 21st century.”

Speaking at the valedictory session of the 155{+t}{+h}anniversary celebration of the Indian Penal Code, Mr. Mukherjee pointed out that “the IPC has undergone very few changes in the last 155 years. Very few crimes have been added to the initial list and declared punishable. Even now, here are offences in the code which were enacted by the British to meet their colonial needs. Yet, there are many new offences which have to be properly defined and incorporated in the code,” he said.

Mr. Mukeherjee said the century “witnessed the proliferation of technology in wider spaces of human interaction and transaction. It has resulted in greater conveniences but, at the same time, has led to the occurrences of newer types of offences.”

Chief Minister Oommen Chandy, Chief Justice of the High Court of Kerala Ashok Bhushan, Kerala Governor P. Satashivam, Advocate General K.P. Dandapani and K.V. Thomas, MP, were among those who attended.
title: President calls for thorough IPC revision
